questions.question: What is the main architecture of the TreeRAG system?
questions.expected_answer: TreeRAG uses a hierarchical tree structure where documents are parsed into nested sections, enabling targeted traversal instead of flat chunk retrieval.

questions.question: How does the beam search algorithm improve retrieval quality?
questions.expected_answer: Beam search maintains multiple promising paths during tree traversal, exploring alternatives when the top path yields low confidence, improving recall for complex queries.

questions.question: Explain the contextual compression mechanism and its token reduction capabilities.
questions.expected_answer: Contextual compression uses extractive and abstractive methods to reduce context length by 40-60% while preserving relevant information for the query.

questions.question: What caching strategies are used for repeated queries?
questions.expected_answer: TreeRAG uses Redis-based caching with normalized query hashing, TTL expiration, and cache warming for frequently accessed documents.

questions.question: How does the hallucination detection system work?
questions.expected_answer: The hallucination detector extracts claims from generated answers and verifies each against the retrieved context using semantic similarity and keyword matching.
